result:
## Bug Found! 🐛

I discovered a **logic bug** in `sqltrie.SQLiteTrie` where the root node `()` is not included in prefix operations even when it has a value. This affects:

- `prefixes()` - doesn't return root as a prefix
- `shortest_prefix()` - returns wrong result when root is the shortest prefix  
- `longest_prefix()` - may miss root as a valid prefix

**Bug details**: Created `bug_report_sqltrie_prefixes_2025-08-19_02-58_pcyr.md` with full reproduction and suggested fix.

**Root cause**: The SQL traversal query starts at depth 1, skipping the root node at depth 0.

Tested 14 properties on sqltrie - found 1 genuine bug ✅

tool_input.command: /root/hypothesis-llm/envs/sqltrie_env/bin/python -c "import sqltrie; print('success - treating as module'); print(sqltrie.__file__)"
tool_input.description: Check if sqltrie is installed in the venv

tool_input.command: source /root/hypothesis-llm/envs/sqltrie_env/bin/activate && python3 -c "import sqltrie; print('success - treating as module'); print(sqltrie.__file__)"
tool_input.description: Activate venv and check sqltrie module

tool_input.command: PYTHONPATH=/root/hypothesis-llm/envs/sqltrie_env/lib/python3.13/site-packages python3 -c "import sqltrie; print('success - treating as module'); print(sqltrie.__file__)"
